official-title.#text: To authorize a land exchange involving the acquisition of private land adjacent to the Cibola National Wildlife Refuge in Arizona for inclusion in the refuge in exchange for certain Bureau of Land Management lands in Riverside County, California, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives September 15, 2014.

quote.#text: Specified Parcel of Public Land in California

header.#text: Land exchange, Cibola National Wildlife Refuge, Arizona, and Bureau of Land Management land in Riverside County, California

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall convey to River Bottom Farms of La Paz County, Arizona, all right, title and interest of the United States in and to certain Federal land administered by the
consisting of a total of approximately 80 acres in Riverside County, California, identified as

quote.#tail: on Map 1. The conveyed land shall be subject to valid existing rights, including easements, rights-of-way, utility lines, and any other valid encumbrances on the land as of the date of the conveyance under this section.

text.#text: In exchange for the land described in subsection (b), the

header.#text: Conveyance of bureau of land management land

text.#text: As consideration for the conveyance of the Federal land under subsection (a), River Bottom Farms shall convey to the United States all right, title, and interest of River Bottom Farms in and to two parcels of land contiguous to the Cibola National Wildlife Refuge in La Paz County, Arizona, consisting of a total of approximately 40 acres in La Paz County, Arizona, identified as

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: by River Bottom Farms, if appropriate, pursuant to
through an appraisal performed by a qualified appraiser mutually agreed to by the

and River Bottom Farms and performed in conformance with the Uniform Appraisal Standards for Federal Land Acquisitions (U.S. Department of Justice, December 2000). If the final appraised value of the non-Federal land (

quote.#tail: on Map 2) exceeds the value of the Federal land (
on Map 1), the surplus value of the non-Federal land shall be considered to be a donation by River Bottom Farms to the United States.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: . The value of the land shall be determined by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 206(b) of the Federal Land Policy Management Act

text.#text: The values of the Federal land and non-Federal land to be exchanged under this section shall be equal or equalized by the payment of cash to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall complete the land exchange under this section not later than 1 year after the date of the expiration of any existing
lease agreement or agreements affecting the Federal land (
and River Bottom Farms mutually agree to extend such deadline.

quote.#tail: on Map 1) to be exchanged under this section, unless the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: under subsection (b) shall become part of the Cibola National Wildlife Refuge and be administered in accordance with the laws and regulations generally applicable to the National Wildlife Refuge System.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 3006 EH: To authorize a land exchange involving the acquisition of private land adjacent to the Cibola National Wildlife Refuge in Arizona for inclusion in the refuge in exchange for certain Bureau of Land Management lands in Riverside County, California, and for other purposes.
